channel.title: Problems on Algorithms
channel.description: Recent content in Problems on Algorithms

item.title: Add Two Numbers
item.description: Problem Statement You are given two non-empty linked lists representing two non-negative integers. The digits are stored in reverse order and each of their nodes contain a single digit. Add the two numbers and return it as a linked list. You may assume the two numbers do not contain any leading zero, except the number 0 itself. Solution

item.title: Two Sum
item.description: Problem Statement Given an array of integers, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to a specific target. You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution, and you may not use the same element twice. Questions to ask Is the input array already sorted? Is The input array mutable or read only? Solution There are three main approaches to solve this problem: Naive, Time Optimized,Memory Optimized.
